intro: Oreomyrrhis pumila, commonly known as the dwarf myrrh plant, is a small, herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in late spring, which are clustered in a dense, terminal inflorescence. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to full sun conditions. Oreomyrrhis pumila is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub ecosystems.
